means: （使）倾斜( incline的第三人称单数 )
点（头）（以示同意、打招呼等）

sentence.Network_en: His letter inclines me to believe that he doesn't want to come.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的书信使我倾向于认为他不愿意来.

sentence.Network_en: The road inclines to the right.
Increasing knowledge inclines one to further study.
sentence.Network_cn: 与日俱增的知识使人更倾向于更进一步的研究.

PerfectNetExp.abs: His sincerity inclines me to trust him ., 他很真诚 , 不由得我不信任他.
To stand straight and never mind if shadow inclines ., 身正不怕影儿斜.

list.abs: U t F 0 e i k r d dU P r 式中F(θ0,θ)为倾斜因子(inclination factor), 取决.

entry.def: If you incline to think or act in a particular way, or if something inclines you to it, you are likely to think or act in that way.

example.ex: I incline to the view that he is right.
example.tran: 我倾向于认为他是正确的。

example.ex: ...the factors which incline us towards particular beliefs...
example.tran: 使我们倾向于相信某些特定信仰的因素

entry.def: If you incline your head, you bend your neck so that your head is leaning forward.

example.ex: Jack inclined his head very slightly.

entry.def: An incline is land that slopes at an angle.

example.ex: He came to a halt at the edge of a steep incline.
example.tran: 他在一个陡坡边上停住了。

auth_sentence.content: The inclines are gentle and the surface is generally good.
auth_sentence.res_content: The inclines are gentle and the surface is generally good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The inclines are gentle and the surface is generally good.

auth_sentence.content: The young man inclines his head graciously.
auth_sentence.res_content: The young man inclines his head graciously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The young man inclines his head graciously.

auth_sentence.content: This saves your transmission from wear, especially on steep inclines.
auth_sentence.res_content: This saves your transmission from wear, especially on steep inclines.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This saves your transmission from wear, especially on steep inclines.
